I find that my zenith depends on
A most auspicious star, whose influence
If now I do not court but omit, my fortune
Will sag forever. Here, stop further questions:
You are inclined to sleep; it's a good dullness,
And forget it: I know you can't choose.
Come, servant, come. I'm ready now.
Come closer, my Ariel, come.

ARIEL:
Hello everyone, great master! serious sir, hello! I'm coming
To meet your best pleasure; it's not for stealing,
Swim, dive into fire, ride
On the curly clouds, to your strong task
Ariel and all her quality.

PROSPERO:
Have you, mind,
Have you fulfilled the storm that I commanded you?

ARIEL:
With each article.
I boarded the king's ship; now on the beak,
Now at the waist, on deck, in every cabin,
I inflamed astonishment: sometimes I would divide,
And burns in many places; on the upper mast,
The yards and the bowsprit, would I like to blaze distinctly,
So meet and join us. Jupiter's lightning, the precursors
O the terrible claps of thunder, more momentary
And there was no distance in sight; fire and cracks
From the sulphurous roar of the most powerful Neptune
Seem to besiege and shake its bold waves,
Yeah, his fearsome trident is shaking.

PROSPERO:
My brave spirit!
Who was so firm, so constant, that this coil
Would it not contaminate his reason?

ARIEL:
Not a soul
But I felt a crazy fever and I played
Some tips of despair. All except the sailors
Dipped in the foaming brine and leaving the ship,
Then everything ignited with me: the king's son, Ferdinand,
With hair raised, then like reeds, not hair,
Was the first man to jump; shouted, "Hell is empty
And all the devils are there.

PROSPERO:
Why is it my mind!
But wasn't it a nearby shore?

ARIEL:
Very close, my master.

PROSPERO:
But are they, Ariel, safe?

ARIEL:
Not a hair perished;
There is no blemish on their clothes that support them,
But fresher than before: and, as you asked me,
In troops, I scattered them around the island.
I landed the king's son alone;
That I let freshen the air with sighs
In a strange corner of the island and sitting,
His arms in this sad knot.

PROSPERO:
From the king's ship
The sailors say how you arranged
And the rest of the fleet.

ARIEL:
Safely at port
It is the king's ship; in the deep corner, where once
You called me at midnight to look for dew

The sailors were all stowed under the hatches;
Who, with a charm joined to their labor suffered,
I remained asleep; and for the rest of the fleet
That I dispersed, they all saw each other again
And we are on the Mediterranean flotilla,
Unfortunately I'm going home to Naples,
Assuming they saw the king's ship wreck
And his great person will perish.

PROSPERO:
Ariel, your charge
This is exactly what has been accomplished: but there is still work to be done.
What is the time of day?

ARIEL:
Past mid-season.

PROSPERO:

My freedom.

No.

No sir.

Sir, to Argier.

Oh, was she? I have to

ARIEL:
Yes sir.

PROSPERO:
This blue-eyed witch was brought here with a child

Except for the son she threw here,
A freckled dragonet, born to an old witch, and not honored by
A human form.

ARIEL:
Yes, Caliban his son.

PROSPERO:

To attack the damned, let Sycorax
I could no longer undo: it was my art,
When I arrived and heard you, it made my mouth drop

ARIEL:
Thank you, master.

Sorry, master;
I will be command correspondent

PROSPERO:

I will free you.

ARIEL:
He is my noble master!

The strangeness of your story

Shake. Come on;

CALIBAN:

PROSPERO:
Get out, I say! there is other business for you:
Come on, turtle! When?
Beautiful appearance! My picturesque Ariel,
Listen to your ear.

ARIEL:
My lord, it will be done.

PROSPERO:
You, poisonous slave, obtained by the devil himself
On your evil mother, get out!

CALIBAN:
Dew as wicked as ever my mother touched
With the raven's feather from the unhealthy swamps
You two go! a blow from the southwest on you
And you all are blistering!

PROSPERO:
For that, be sure, tonight you will have cramps,
Side points that will hold your breath; sea urchins
Must, during this vast night so that they can work,
Everything affects you; you will be pinched
As thick as a honeycomb, every pinch is tangier
Than the bees who made them.

CALIBAN:
I have to eat dinner.
This island is mine, through Sycorax my mother,
That you take me. When you arrived first,
You caressed me and you made a lot of me, you gave me
Water with berries and teach me how
To name the greater light, and how the less,
Which burns day and night: and then I loved you
And I showed you all the qualities of the island,
Fresh springs, brines, arid and fertile places:
Cursed be I who did this! All the charms
Sycorax, toads, beetles, bats, light on you!
For I am all the subjects that you have,
The first was my own king: and here you block me
In this hard rock, while you hide from me
The rest of the island.

PROSPERO:
You, the most lying slave,
That stripes can move, but kindness cannot! I used you,
Dirty as you are, with human care, and sheltered you
In my own cell, until you seek to rape
The honor of my child.

CALIBAN:
Oh oh oh ! that would not have been done!
You stopped me; I had populated others
This island with Calibans.

PROSPERO:
Abhorred slave,
That every imprint of kindness will not take,
To be capable of all evils! I pitied you,
I took care to make you talk, I taught you every hour
One thing or another: when you didn't do it, savage,
Know your own meaning, but I would chatter like
A most brutal thing, I endowed your designs
With words that made them known. But your vile race,
Although you learned, you had what
good character
I couldn't stand to be around; that's why you were
Rightly confined in this rock,
Who deserved more than a prison.

CALIBAN:
You taught me the language; and my profit does not depend
It's true, I know how to swear. The red plague got rid of you
For teaching me your language!

PROSPERO:
Witch seed, then!
Bring us fuel; and be quick, you are better,
To respond to other business. Are you shrugging your shoulders, meanness?
If you neglect or do reluctantly
What I command, I will torture you with old cramps,
Fill all your bones with pain, make you roar
That the animals will tremble at your noise.

CALIBAN:
No, please.
I must obey: his art is of such power,
This would control my mother's god, Setebos,
and make him a vassal.

PROSPERO:
So, slave; Thus!
Come to these yellow sands,
And then take the hand:
Courted when you did and kissed
The wild waves whistle,
Pied-a-terre here and there;
And, sweet elf, the pack bear.
Listen, listen!

FERDINAND:
Where should this music be? am I air or earth?
It no longer rings: and of course, it waits
An island god. Sitting on a bank,
Still mourning the king over my father's wreck,
This music crept near me on the waters,
Appease both their fury and my passion
With his gentle air: from there I followed him,
Or rather, it attracted me. But it's gone.
No, it's starting again.
Full breaststroke five, your father lies;
Coral is made of its bones;
Her eyes were pearls:
Nothing about him fades
